Certainly! Below is the Mermaid diagram code that represents the architecture from the image:

```mermaid
graph TD;
    A(User/Browser Layer) -->|HTTP Requests| B(Web Server Layer)
    B -->|File Operations| C(File System)
    B -->|Database Queries| D(Database Layer)
    C -->|System Calls| E(Operating System Layer)
    D -->|System Calls| E

    subgraph A [User/Browser Layer]
        F(Web Browser)
        F --> UserSearch[User Search]
        F --> FileManagement[File Management]
        F --> Guestbook[Guestbook]
        F --> NetworkTools[Network Tools]
    end

    subgraph B [Web Server Layer (Apache + PHP)]
        G(Apache HTTP) --> PHP[PHP Engine 7.4+]
        PHP --> UserSearch
        PHP --> Authentication[Authentication]
        PHP --> Sessions[Sessions]
        PHP --> UserAdmin[User Admin]
        PHP --> Security[Security]
        PHP --> Guestbook
        PHP --> NetworkTools
        PHP --> FileUpload[File Upload]
        PHP --> Configuration[Configuration]
    end

    subgraph C [File System]
        H(Upload Directory)
        I(Config Files)
        J(Application Code)
    end

    subgraph D [Database Layer]
        K(MySQL/MariaDB)
        L(users)
        M(guestbook)
    end

    subgraph E [Operating System Layer]
        N(Linux/Windows)
        O(System Services)
        P(File System)
        Q(Network Stack)
        R(API Endpoints)
    end
```

This diagram represents the layers and components as described in the architecture.
